p: The resulting dynamics of System ( 1) is shown in Fig. 1. After an initial growth of the epidemic, the perceived prevalence reaches the prevalence threshold 1 ∕ m and the altered behavior becomes more convenient. As a consequence when the altered behavior became widely adopted in the population, which occurs after few days, the epidemic growth rate reduces remarkably. As the prevalence decreases below the threshold, the normal behavior becomes more convenient and its diffusion produces a fat tail in the infection dynamics.
